column5: Hey Guys,  I was wondering if darlingtom provincial park had any fishing opportunities for the shore bound angler (McLaughlin Bay), or perhaps someone with an inflatable who really can't go too far from shore. If there are opportunities to fish this location, then what kind of species can one get into ? what kind of techniques work best for this place.  Thanks
They have that one on Google as well.
just park down at courtice beach, i'd say around dusk...
Have you tried using the search function ? It's helped me alot in the passed when I was looking for a PP in the NN region.

the ontarioparks.com site has some basic info about the parks themselves on their respective webpages.  look around the site, there is quite a bit of info.  ontario parks website:   ontario parks   ryan
I went there once to check it out.  I fished in a small bay for a little while.  Didn't catch anything.  It looked like a good carp spot, but don't know for sure.
